actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation

official_title: To amend title 46, United States Code, to protect seamen against economic reprisal.
short_title: Protection of Seamen Against Economic Reprisal Act of 1998
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Protection of Seamen Against Economic Reprisal Act of 1998 - Amends Federal shipping law to prohibit an owner, charterer, managing operator, agent, master, or individual in charge of a vessel from discharging, temporarily removing, or in any manner discriminating against a seaman because he or she refuses to violate provisions governing shipping and seamen law. Authorizes a U.S. district court in which a seaman has brought an action for wrongful discharge or discrimination to award such seaman costs and reasonable attorney's fees.

titles.title: Protection of Seamen Against Economic Reprisal Act of 1998
To amend title 46, United States Code, to protect seamen against economic reprisal.
